pre-task.applicable-cars: C Car, S Car, T Car

list-item.para: Circuit breaker DOOR CONTROL CB33 switched to OFF.
Circuit breaker PA AMPLIFIER CB47 switched to OFF.
Circuit breaker COMMUNICATION SYSTEM CB48 switched to OFF.

equipment-item.title: S-Car and T-Car Communication Control Unit
Ground lockwasher, sst 18-8, for no 10-24 stud

hazard.hazard-desc: When performing maintenance, finding access doors unlocked on normally-secured lockers or cabinets must be reported to supervisor.

step.para: Unlock and open locker L1 access door using NJ Transit coach key.
Remove electronics rack shield/cover.

hazard.hazard-desc: Cables connected to locker equipment can cause electrical shock. Exercise care whenever accessing any of the electrical lockers. Failure to do so may result in injury or death.
The following steps are performed while some locker equipment may be powered. Exercise care whenever near powered equipment. Failure to do so may result in injury or death.

step.para: Remove six car wiring cables (9) connected to circular connectors of Communication Control Unit (CCU) unit (1).
Remove one nut (5) one lockwasher (7), and one washer (8) securing ground wire terminal to CCU ground stud. Discard lockwasher.

hazard.hazard-desc: Communication Control Unit weighs close to 50 lb. Use appropriate lifting device or table to support Communication Control Unit. Failure to do so may result in Injury or damage to equipment.

step.para: Remove four capscrews (4), four lockwashers (5), four washers (3), and four U-type spring nuts (2) securing CCU to locker structure. Discard lockwashers (5).
Remove U-type spring nuts (2) from locker structure.
Using grab handles, slide CCU out of locker L1 and set aside.
Position U-type spring nuts (2) on locker L1 structure, aligning with mounting holes.

hazard.hazard-desc: Communication Control Unit weighs close to 50 lb. Use appropriate lifting device or table to support Communication Control Unit. Failure to do so may result in Injury or damage to equipment.

step.para: Using grab handles, lift CCU and carefully position in locker L1. Align CCU mounting notches with spring nuts (2) installed on locker L1.
Secure CCU to four U-type spring nuts (2) installed on locker structure with four capscrews (4), four new lockwashers (5), and washers (3)
Torque four capscrews (4) to 6 ft-lb and mark with Torque-Seal.
Inspect area on CCU front panel around ground stud for rust, grime, grease, or oil. If required, clean ground wire terminal mounting area around ground stud as follows.
Using brush, remove dirt or paint from area surrounding ground stud.
Using cloth soaked with mineral spirits, remove any oily or greasy deposits from area surrounding ground stud.
Secure ground wire terminal (8) to ground stud on CCU front panel with one nut (6) and washer (7).
Restore power to CCU:

list-item.para: Switch circuit breaker DOOR CONTROL CB33 to ON.
Switch circuit breaker PA AMPLIFIER CB47 to ON.
Switch circuit breaker COMMUNICATION SYSTEM CB48 to ON.

step.para: From car locker L1, ensure CCU toggle switch POWER is set to position ON.
Allow CCU to power-up self-test and initialize, then ensure LED indicators on CCU front panel are as follows:
Replace electronics rack shield/cover.
Close and lock locker L1 access door using NJ Transit coach key.
Activate cab by setting train operator console controls as follows.
Master Controller keyed
Master Controller Reverser set to F (Forward) to activate cab
Master Controller Throttle switch set to 0 (Idle).
In active cab, verify CCU status on Driver DIsplay Unit (DDU) as follows.
From DDU Train Overview screen, click Local Process Data softkey button.
From DDU Process Data screen for vehicle, ensure field CCU displays OK.
